name: Frank Hutchison
description: '''Frank Hutchison''' (March 20, 1897 – November 9, 1945) was an American early [[country blues]] and [[Piedmont blues]] musician and songwriter. [[Okeh Records]] promotional materials referred to him as “The Pride of [[West Virginia]],” and he is thought to be the first non-African American musician to record in the [[country blues]] idiom. Hutchison was best known as a [[slide guitar]] player, where he held the guitar in his lap and used a pen knife as a slide.
